name: Matcha Hatsu-Mukashi, 30g Can
description: Matcha can be prepared in two ways: "usucha" (thin tea) and "koicha" (thick tea), each bringing out different charms of matcha. "Hatsu-Mukashi" is recommended for koicha (thick tea). It offers a deep, rich flavor that lingers on the tongue with slight bitterness. It has a complex and elegant mouthfeel.

name: Matcha Ato-Mukashi, 30g Can
description: Matcha can be prepared in two ways: "usucha" (thin tea) and "koicha" (thick tea), each bringing out different charms of matcha.  "Ato-Mukashi" is recommended for koicha (thick tea). It is elegant, offering a blend of delicacy and complexity with a rich, deep flavor.

name: Matcha Hatsu-no-Mukashi, 30g Can
description: Omotesenke Jimyosai Sosho's favorite Matcha. Matcha can be prepared in two ways: "usucha" (thin tea) and "koicha" (thick tea), each bringing out different charms of matcha.  "Matcha Hatsu-no-Mukashi" is recommended for koicha (thick tea).

name: Matcha Seiko-no-Mukashi, 30g Can
description: Urasenke Hounsai Sosho's favorite Matcha. Matcha can be prepared in two ways: "usucha" (thin tea) and "koicha" (thick tea), each bringing out different charms of matcha.  "Matcha Seiko-no-Mukashi" is recommended for both usucha (thin tea) and koicha (thick tea).

name: Matcha Senun-no-Shiro,Can 30g
description: Matcha can be prepared in two ways: "usucha" (thin tea) and "koicha" (thick tea), each bringing out different charms of matcha.  "Senun no Shiro"  is a Thin grade matcha, We recommend preparing it as such. This tea does have strong bitterness and acidic taste to it.

name: Matcha Hiroha-no-Shiro,Can 30g
description: Matcha can be prepared in two ways: "usucha" (thin tea) and "koicha" (thick tea), each bringing out different charms of matcha.  Since "Hiroha no Shiro"  is a Thin grade matcha, We recommend preparing it as such. It has a subtle umami flavor, giving the Matcha a slight bitterness and acidity.

name: Matcha Wako, Can 40g
description: Matcha can be prepared in two ways: "usucha" (thin tea) and "koicha" (thick tea), each bringing out different charms of matcha. Wako characterized by a refreshing aroma and a light, smooth finish. Recommended for making thin tea. Goes great with all kinds of confectionery.

name: Matcha Kirin, Can 40g
description: Matcha can be prepared in two ways: "usucha" (thin tea) and "koicha" (thick tea), each bringing out different charms of matcha. Kirin, the unique refreshing, rich flavor with a smooth finish make this one of Marukyu Koyamaen’s most popular principal Matchas.

name: Matcha Isuzu, Can 40g
description: Matcha can be prepared in two ways: "usucha" (thin tea) and "koicha" (thick tea), each bringing out different charms of matcha. Isuzu - Characterized by a good balance between a refreshing aroma, an astringent, mellow umami and a slightly bitter flavor. Recommended for making thin tea. Also perfect for mixing with milk or cream.

name: Matcha Unkaku, Can 40g
description: Matcha can be prepared in two ways: "usucha" (thin tea) and "koicha" (thick tea), each bringing out different charms of matcha. Characterized by a soft, smooth finish, this premium-grade Matcha also has a sweet aroma and rich flavor. It’s also one of the most popular of all Marukyu Koyamaen’s principal Matchas.Suitable for making both thick and thin teas.

name: Matcha Choan, Can 40g
description: Matcha can be prepared in two ways: "usucha" (thin tea) and "koicha" (thick tea), each bringing out different charms of matcha. Characterized by a soft, gentle flavor. You’ll definitely want to relax and enjoy the elegant aroma of this Matcha. Recommended for making a thin tea with a thicker texture. Comes with the tea’s name printed on the packaging box.

name: Matcha Aoarashi, Can 40g
description: Matcha can be prepared in two ways: "usucha" (thin tea) and "koicha" (thick tea), each bringing out different charms of matcha. Characterized by a refreshing flavor. Recommended for making thin tea. Also perfect for mixing with milk or cream to make confectionery.

name: Matcha Ummon, Can 40g
description: Ummon has a powerful umami, deep emerald green color, and sweet aroma. This matcha is a treat to be savored.

name: Matcha Seiun, Can 40g
description: Seiun places firmly in our rich category. Its lingering finish and full umami character make it a wise choice for fans of a reflective, satisfying matcha teatime.

name: Matcha Sayaka, Can 40g
description: Our recommendation for people new to our matcha, Sayaka is a more light-hearted, smooth tea in the rich category. Its sweetness and umami are accompanied by a hint of bitterness.

name: Matcha Whisk - Chasen #1
description: The chasen matcha whisk is an essential tool for making the perfect bowl of matcha. The Chasen #1 is recommended for those who enjoy making matcha with a chasen on a daily basis.

name: Matcha Whisk - Chasen #2
description: The chasen matcha whisk is an essential tool for making the perfect bowl of matcha. The Chasen #1 is recommended for those who enjoy making matcha with a chasen on a daily basis.

name: Matcha Whisk Stand - Chasen-tate
description: This ceramic whisk holder (chasen-tate) is sturdy and light. After rinsing, protect and store your chasen by placing it in this holder, with the tips facing down. This allows your chasen to dry nicely in between matcha sessions.

name: Ha’ Matcha Whisk
description: The 80-tip bamboo matcha whisk from Japan-based Ha’ Porcelain was selected with meticulous attention to detail. Ha’ Porcelain collaborated with a local tea master to find a whisk perfectly crafted for an authentic matcha experience. Constructed in the traditional Japanese tea ceremony style, this tool will whisk your matcha into the ideal smooth and frothy texture.

name: Craft Matcha
description: From the renowned matcha region of Uji, Japan, we bring you ceremonial-grade Craft Matcha. Our Kyoto team explored the mountains of Japan to find a matcha that embodies the quality and taste we demand out of our coffee. We choose tender tea leaves from our producer’s first harvest of tencha, or shade-grown matcha plants, and stone-mill them to protect against heat degradation.

name: Ha' Matcha Bowl
description: Made to complement our Matcha Cup Set, the Matcha Bowl from Japan-based Ha’ Porcelain by Tokyo Saikai is crafted from a unique blend of porcelain and earth, highlighted by its bare foot and a custom navy blue glaze.This beautiful bowl makes a thoughtful holiday gift — perfect for when friends gather. An elegant addition to any home, it invites relaxation and connection over a warm cup of our Craft Matcha.

name: Matcha Chikka, Can 20g
description: Chikka is a beautiful matcha, artfully blended by Kobayashi san from leaves grown in Kyotanabe, Uji. Showcasing the verdant and fresh profile that the area is famed for, Chikka is a pinnacle grade matcha from a true master.

name: Matcha Suiho Organic, Can 20g
description: Suiho is a representation of the development of Kiyoharu Tsuji's practice and partnership with Kettl. Organic matcha is a novelty in Japan, often associated with lower quality tea produced for export. Grown under Tsuji san's watchful eye, Suiho is a JAS certified organic matcha of the highest order. With a dynamic profile that boasts electric freshness and rich umami in equal measure, Suiho is a remarkable demonstration of the potential of organic production.

name: Matcha Fuujun, Can 20g
description: Fuujun is a truly special matcha that showcases Kobayashi san's unparalleled prowess at blending pinnacle grade teas to create something greater than the sum of its parts. Remarkably rich, smooth, and fresh, Fuujun is a matcha of unparalleled quality.

name: Matcha Yamagumo, Can 40g
description: Yamagumo is a decadent and dynamic matcha produced by the master Chashi Hiroshi Kobayashi of the Shogyokuen tea company. Blended specifically for Kettl, Yamagumo is a versatile usucha grade matcha that possesses a character rich enough to shine through milk while showcasing a striking freshness when whisked traditionally. Featuring a fragrant verdant profile with a soft and pleasing astringency on the finish, this matcha represents incredible value and versatility in our growing catalog.

name: Shigeyoshi Morioka Katakuchi Chawan 72
description: We are thrilled to share this one-of-a-kind wood fired tea bowl from the master potter Shigeyoshi Morioka. Based in Wakayama prefecture, Morioka san is an influential potter who has made a lasting impact on Japanese ceramics not only through his own work but also his guidance and tutelage to a younger generation of potters. Morioka san’s works with multiple styles of clay and is known for his experimentation with glazes and firing times. His work is both expressive and functional and is at home both in the tea room, and your own home. This piece was sourced personally by Zach and Minami, Kettl’s owners, at Morioka san’s studio in November 2024.

name: Shigeyoshi Morioka Chawan 49
description: We are thrilled to share this one-of-a-kind wood fired tea bowl from the master potter Shigeyoshi Morioka. Based in Wakayama prefecture, Morioka san is an influential potter who has made a lasting impact on Japanese ceramics not only through his own work but also his guidance and tutelage to a younger generation of potters. Morioka san’s works with multiple styles of clay and is known for his experimentation with glazes and firing times. His work is both expressive and functional and is at home both in the tea room, and your own home. This piece was sourced personally by Zach and Minami, Kettl’s owners, at Morioka san’s studio in November 2024.

name: Chikusendou Shin Chasen Matcha Whisk
description: Hand Carved from old growth bamboo in the town of Nara, outside of Kyoto, by Kubo Kyosuke. Whisks of this quality are not only stronger but provide more flexibility and "give" while holding up significantly longer than lower quality, cheaply made chasen. Each piece is a miniature work of art taking over 2 hours to complete.

name: Chikusendou Shin Chasen Matcha Whisk
description: Hand Carved from old growth bamboo in the town of Nara, outside of Kyoto, by Kubo Kyosuke. Whisks of this quality are not only stronger but provide more flexibility and "give" while holding up significantly longer than lower quality, cheaply made chasen. Each piece is a miniature work of art taking over 2 hours to complete.

name: 80 Tine Chasen (Matcha Whisk)
description: An 80 tine whisk perfect for everyday use. This is studio made, meaning multiple artisans work on the pieces. We recommend this as a great option for those who make matcha 3-5 times a week. Hand made Bamboo whisk for a Japanese studio. Bamboo sourced from China.
